intro: Peplidium diandrum, commonly known as the two-styled peplidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a small annual herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Peplidium diandrum is notable for its unique reproductive structures, including two distinct styles in its flowers.
